p: It is well known that villi and crypts in the small intestine contribute to the digestion and absorption of dietary nutrients [ 28]. Moreover, previous studies have reported that feeding indigestible carbohydrates such as mannanoligosaccharides to poultry increases villus height [ 29]. Therefore, in the present study, we considered that feeding BSF-derived chitin would also increase villus height. However, unexpectedly, no differences in the villus height or crypt depth were detected among hen groups.
